snippet: New Mexico and other states with increasingly diverse populations have strained to meet the rising cost of providing court interpreters for non-English speakers.
abstract: New Mexico and other states with increasingly diverse populations have strained to meet the rising cost of providing court interpreters for non-English speaking residents; about 36 percent of New Mexico's 2.1 million residents over age 5 speak language other than English, almost double national rate; Justice Dept has stepped up enforcement of laws requiring court interpreters, forcing corrective action in many states.
lead_paragraph: New Mexico and other states with increasingly diverse populations have strained to meet the rising cost of providing court interpreters for non-English speakers.

headline.main: As the Demand for Court Interpreters Climbs, State Budget Conflicts Grow as Well
headline.print_headline: As the Demand for Court Interpreters Climbs, State Budget Conflicts Grow as Well
